Posts.Content: I wasn't sure if I should have added this to old thread , but yesterday I had my biopsy. My biopsy was set for 11:00, but I wasn't seem until 12:00. Was told something happened unexpected on first bio of the day. Great I said... I was given antibiotics starting day before. I was also numbed. I think I was really nervous because before taking first sample I started to feel shaky. The doctor would tell me ... Breath in here I go. My the 2 times, I was fainting. Nurse had to stop doctor and gave me juice and cookies. Talk about weird. After I was done I was giving discharge instructions. Doctor told me he found an hyperechroic lump and took two extra samples of that... I'm scared. Doctor did not tell me anything else but that he will see me on Monday 11. Please keep me in your prayers. I'm in some pain and I'm bleeding everytime a pee. This was not easy but I know it's what I need to do. Thanks everyone
Posts.Title: biopsy yesterday- experience

Posts.Content: My story starts in 2013 when I was 47, when I start experiencing urinary issues which landed me in ER, I was suffering from kidney stones and a bad infection. MIR showed kidney stone coming down, nothing else. In 2014, I saw a uriologst for the kidney issues, all he did was lab work, nothing bad every came back. I did not ask about PSA at the time since I had no idea what that was. Since my kidney stones, I often get UTI which I get antibiotics for, but since then my lower back always hurts and my urine steam is weak and I go to rest room more often. After being pushed by my daughter, I went to my PCP and asked for a DRE. He found a nodule on the right side (the same side where my kidney stone came down.) He did NOT refer me to a urologist but instead sent me to have an prostate ultrasound. I'm scared, I'm only 50 year old and have no record of my PSA to even have any idea. My ultrasound is on Friday and although my PCP doesn't know, I have set an appointment with a urologist on Tuesday Feb 23. I have read that once a nodule can be felt by DRE, the cancer is likely to be more advanced? Is this true? Another question is why didn't my PCP just sent me to a urologist who can do ultrasound and biopsy? In my mind I'm just wasting time, if the ultrasound shows something than I have to have a biopsy, if I was under the care of a urologist I could do both at once. Another thing I'm wondering about is that the facility doing my ultrasound wants me to have a full bladder before the test. I have not read anything about needing a full bladder for a prostate ultrasound. I'm confused. I have no family history, not African American. Any advice is welcomed.

AgeInfo.Phrase: in 2013 when I was 47  when I start experiencing urinary
<Z> I'm scared  I'm only 50 year old and have no

Posts.Title: Doctor found nodule during DRE, my first ever, no PSA record.. long history of UTI

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone! It's very hard for me to stay claim. Last week I had such little information regarding PC and now I have so much information that I don't know how to even process it. I obviously don't want this to be cancer but more importantly if it is I want it to be early stage and the fact that my PCP felt something scares me so much. I'm praying to God it's some type of mistake or a non cancerous growth (which I hard is like a 50/50 chance) I'll let you all know what happens soon, but in the meantime I really want to continue to receive your insights.
Posts.Title: Doctor found nodule during DRE, my first ever, no PSA record.. long history of UTI

Posts.Content: Thank you all. On Friday before my ultrasound, I'm going back to my PCP who is taking blood drawn for full blood work plus PSA. I'm wondering if I should go to another local doctor for another DRE or will urologist perform one on the 23rd.
